intro: Cordia jacmeliana, commonly known as the Jacmelian Cordia, is a small evergreen tree native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. It thrives in coastal and tropical environments, often found in dry to moist soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
